t: John 10

Verily,*rp verily,*r I*r say*r unto*r you,*r He*r that*r entereth*r not*r by*r the*r door*r into*r the*r sheepfold,*r but*r climbeth*r up*r some*r other*r way,*r the*r same*r is*r a*r thief*r and*r a*r robber.*r
But*rp he*r that*r entereth*r in*r by*r the*r door*r is*r the*r shepherd*r of*r the*r sheep.*r
To*rp him*r the*r porter*r openeth;*r and*r the*r sheep*r hear*r his*r voice:*r and*r he*r calleth*r his*r own*r sheep*r by*r name,*r and*r leadeth*r them*r out.*r
And*rp when*r he*r putteth*r forth*r his*r own*r sheep,*r he*r goeth*r before*r them,*r and*r the*r sheep*r follow*r him:*r for*r they*r know*r his*r voice.*r
And*rp a*r stranger*r will*r they*r not*r follow,*r but*r will*r flee*r from*r him:*r for*r they*r know*r not*r the*r voice*r of*r strangers.*r
This*p parable spake Jesus unto them: but they understood not what things they were which he spake unto them.
Then*p said Jesus unto them again, Verily,*r verily,*r I*r say*r unto*r you,*r I*r am*r the*r door*r of*r the*r sheep.*r
All*rp that*r ever*r came*r before*r me*r are*r thieves*r and*r robbers:*r but*r the*r sheep*r did*r not*r hear*r them.*r
I*rp am*r the*r door:*r by*r me*r if*r any*r man*r enter*r in,*r he*r shall*r be*r saved,*r and*r shall*r go*r in*r and*r out,*r and*r find*r pasture.*r

The*rp thief*r cometh*r not,*r but*r for*r to*r steal,*r and*r to*r kill,*r and*r to*r destroy:*r I*r am*r come*r that*r they*r might*r have*r life,*r and*r that*r they*r might*r have*r it*r more*r abundantly.*r
I*rp am*r the*r good*r shepherd:*r the*r good*r shepherd*r giveth*r his*r life*r for*r the*r sheep.*r

But*rp he*r that*r is*r an*r hireling,*r and*r not*r the*r shepherd,*r whose*r own*r the*r sheep*r are*r not,*r seeth*r the*r wolf*r coming,*r and*r leaveth*r the*r sheep,*r and*r fleeth:*r and*r the*r wolf*r catcheth*r them,*r and*r scattereth*r the*r sheep.*r
The*rp hireling*r fleeth,*r because*r he*r is*r an*r hireling,*r and*r careth*r not*r for*r the*r sheep.*r
I*rp am*r the*r good*r shepherd,*r and*r know*r my*r sheep,*r and*r am*r known*r of*r mine.*r
As*rp the*r Father*r knoweth*r me,*r even*r so*r know*r I*r the*r Father:*r and*r I*r lay*r down*r my*r life*r for*r the*r sheep.*r

And*rp other*r sheep*r I*r have,*r which*r are*r not*r of*r this*r fold:*r them*r also*r I*r must*r bring,*r and*r they*r shall*r hear*r my*r voice;*r and*r there*r shall*r be*r one*r fold,*r and*r one*r shepherd.*r
Therefore*rp doth*r my*r Father*r love*r me,*r because*r I*r lay*r down*r my*r life,*r that*r I*r might*r take*r it*r again.*r

No*rp man*r taketh*r it*r from*r me,*r but*r I*r lay*r it*r down*r of*r myself.*r I*r have*r power*r to*r lay*r it*r down,*r and*r I*r have*r power*r to*r take*r it*r again.*r This*r commandment*r have*r I*r received*r of*r my*r Father.*r
There*p was a division therefore again among the Jews for these sayings.
And*p many of them said, He hath a devil, and is mad; why hear ye him?
Others*p said, These are not the words of him that hath a devil. Can a devil open the eyes of the blind?
And*p it was at Jerusalem the feast of the dedication, and it was winter.
And*p Jesus walked in the temple in Solomon's porch.
Then*p came the Jews round about him, and said unto him, How long dost thou make us to doubt? If thou be the Christ, tell us plainly.
Jesus*p answered them, I*r told*r you,*r and*r ye*r believed*r not:*r the*r works*r that*r I*r do*r in*r my*r Father's*r name,*r they*r bear*r witness*r of*r me.*r
But*rp ye*r believe*r not,*r because*r ye*r are*r not*r of*r my*r sheep,*r as*r I*r said*r unto*r you.*r
My*rp sheep*r hear*r my*r voice,*r and*r I*r know*r them,*r and*r they*r follow*r me:*r
And*rp I*r give*r unto*r them*r eternal*r life;*r and*r they*r shall*r never*r perish,*r neither*r shall*r any*r man*r pluck*r them*r out*r of*r my*r hand.*r
My*rp Father,*r which*r gave*r them*r me,*r is*r greater*r than*r all;*r and*r no*r man*r is*r able*r to*r pluck*r them*r out*r of*r my*r Father's*r hand.*r
I*rp and*r my*r Father*r are*r one.*r
Then*p the Jews took up stones again to stone him.
Jesus*p answered them, Many*r good*r works*r have*r I*r shewed*r you*r from*r my*r Father;*r for*r which*r of*r those*r works*r do*r ye*r stone*r me?*r
The*p Jews answered him, saying, For a good work we stone thee not; but for blasphemy; and because that thou, being a man, makest thyself God.
Jesus*p answered them, Is*r it*r not*r written*r in*r your*r law,*r I*r said,*r Ye*r are*r gods?*r
If*rp he*r called*r them*r gods,*r unto*r whom*r the*r word*r of*r God*r came,*r and*r the*r scripture*r cannot*r be*r broken;*r
Say*rp ye*r of*r him,*r whom*r the*r Father*r hath*r sanctified,*r and*r sent*r into*r the*r world,*r Thou*r blasphemest;*r because*r I*r said,*r I*r am*r the*r Son*r of*r God?*r
If*rp I*r do*r not*r the*r works*r of*r my*r Father,*r believe*r me*r not.*r
But*rp if*r I*r do,*r though*r ye*r believe*r not*r me,*r believe*r the*r works:*r that*r ye*r may*r know,*r and*r believe,*r that*r the*r Father*r is*r in*r me,*r and*r I*r in*r him.*r
Therefore*p they sought again to take him: but he escaped out of their hand,
And*p went away again beyond Jordan into the place where John at first baptized; and there he abode.
And*p many resorted unto him, and said, John did no miracle: but all things that John spake of this man were true.
And*p many believed on him there.
